PARAGRAPH.STRING: ([Russian: []], Rossiya; pronounced [IPA: [rʌ'sʲi.jə]]), also the Russian Federation ([Russian: []], Rossiyskaya Federatsiya; pronounced [IPA: [rʌ'sʲi.skə.jə fʲɪ.dʲɪ'ra.ʦɪ.jə]], listen), is a country that stretches over a vast expanse of Eurasia. With an area of 17,075,400 square kilometres,
is the largest country in the world by land mass, covering almost twice the territory of the next-largest country, Canada.
has the world's eighth largest population.

shares land borders with the following countries (counter-clockwise from NW to SE): Norway, Finland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Belarus, Ukraine, Georgia, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, China, Mongolia, and North Korea.
is also close to the United States and Japan across relatively small stretches of water.
Formerly the dominant republic of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR),
is now an independent country and an influential member of the Commonwealth of Independent States, since the Union's dissolution in December 1991. During the Soviet era,
was officially called the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic (RSFSR).
is considered the Soviet Union's successor state in diplomatic matters.
Most of the area, population, and industrial production of the Soviet Union, then one of the world's two superpowers, lay in
. After the breakup of the Soviet Union,
global role was greatly diminished compared to that of the former Soviet Union. In October 2005, the federal statistics agency reported that
population has shrunk by more than half a million people dipping to 143 million, although
became the second country in the world by the number of immigrants from abroad.
